news.headline: India’s economic mosaic – what do the big bang macro data releases say?
news.summary: For the Indian economy the number one unknown risk – that of an unexpected adverse weather event – looms. An unusual weather event, if at all, can reverse the gains across growth, inflation, and monetary policy.

news.headline: Railway Budget 2024 Live Updates: 3 major railway corridors announced; 40,000 bogies to be upgraded to Vande Bharat standards
news.summary: Railway Budget 2024 Live Updates: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Union Budget 2024 speech announced that Indian Railways will develop three major railway economic corridors. She also said that Indian Railways will upgrade bogies to Vande Bharat standards. According to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the upgradation of bogies to Vande Bharat standards will make train travel more comfortable for crores of passengers.

news.headline: Railway Budget 2024: Ahead of Budget 2024, Indian Railways sees record capex spending in first 9 months of FY24; details
news.summary: Indian Railways has achieved a record Capex utilization of 75% in the first nine months of the fiscal year 2023-24. This marks a substantial increase compared to the previous year. The total expenditure incurred amounts to Rs 1,95,929.97 crores, which is approximately 33% higher than the same period in the previous fiscal year.

news.headline: Budget 2024: Make annuity income from NPS tax-free - here’s why
news.summary: Tax experts suggest alterations to NPS taxation in Budget 2024. They want annuity income from NPS to be tax-free, aligning with fairness and financial security principles. Taxing annuity income may strain senior citizens' finances. Global trend supports tax exemptions on annuity income. Suggestions include removing NPS contributions from the existing cap or increasing the limit to Rs 15 lakh.

news.headline: Budget 2024: Government’s capex thrust key to bridge infrastructure gap, says former NITI VC Rajiv Kumar
news.summary: Former NITI Aayog vice chairman Rajiv Kumar believes that the upcoming interim budget should focus on capital expenditure due to weak private investment and the need to bridge the infrastructure gap. He expects the finance minister, Nirmala Sitharaman, to achieve fiscal consolidation targets through increased capital expenditure and improved tax-to-GDP ratio.

news.headline: Interim Budget 2024: 10 things every Indian student should look out for in a budget speech
news.summary: Interim Budget 2024 for students: The Interim Budget 2024 being presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is poised to shape the future of education in India, and students should be attentive to the key announcements that can impact their academic and financial journey. By staying informed, students can better navigate the evolving landscape and make informed decisions about their academic pursuits and future careers.

news.headline: Explained: What is Vande Bharat standard of trains to which 40,000 Indian Railways coaches will be upgraded?
news.summary: Vande Bharat standard of trains: Indian Railways aims to upgrade several thousand coaches to Vande Bharat standards? What exactly does this project entail? We take a look at what passengers can look forward to:

news.headline: Budget Highlights 2024 Live Updates: Indian economy witnessed profound positive transformation in last 10 yrs, Sitharaman says
news.summary: The Indian economy has witnessed a profound positive transformation in the last 10 years, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday. Presenting the interim Budget 2024-25, Sitharaman said that the government is working to make India a developed country by 2047. Poor, women, youth and farmers are four castes for the government, she added.

news.headline: BJP Budgets For Third Term
news.summary: Modi government is confident it’s coming back. So, the Finance Minister fixed the fiscal, said no to freebies & told voters, have faith

news.headline: Govt plans to use existing hospital infrastructure to set up more medical colleges: FM Sitharaman
news.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, in the 2024-25 interim Budget, announced plans to establish more medical colleges using existing hospital infrastructure, emphasizing improved healthcare services. A committee will examine this initiative. Additionally, the government aims to boost vaccination for girls aged 9-14 to prevent cervical cancer. Maternal and child healthcare schemes will be streamlined, and Ayushman Bharat healthcare coverage will extend to ASHA workers, Anganwadi workers, and helpers. The U-WIN platform for immunization management and Mission Indradhanush efforts will be rapidly implemented nationwide.

news.headline: Going Slow & Steady
news.summary: There’s optimism about the Indian economy. Growth remains resilient, with comfort on core inflation as it slips below 4%. The external account remains manageable with likely CAD at 1.3% of GDP and Rupee putting up an orderly performance. This comes against global risks of war, geopolitical tensions and elevated, though correcting, inflation.

news.headline: Interim Budget 2024: What record income-tax collections don't tell you about the number of taxpayers
Ranveer Singh and Prasanth Varma in preliminary discussions for a big-budget period drama, details inside
news.summary: Prasanth Varma, who is a huge fan of Ranveer Singh’s work, has been in talks with the actor for a big-budget period film.

news.headline: Budget 2024: FM Nirmala Sitharaman may significantly enhance allocation for farm sector schemes
news.summary: The government is expected to enhance allocation for key farm sector schemes and boost credit in the interim Budget to stimulate the rural economy. This comes as the growth in the agriculture sector is projected to decelerate. The government may increase assistance under the PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi and announce a higher agricultural credit target.

news.headline: Amitabh Kant decodes India's growing importance in the world, mantras to create jobs, Budget focus & more at TOI Right To Excellence Budget Masterclass event
news.summary: “There is a lot of positivity about India,” says Amitabh Kant, G20 Sherpa & Former CEO, Niti Aayog. Participating in a fireside chat at the TOI Right To Excellence Budget Masterclass event.

news.headline: Union Budget 2024: Will the government increase cybersecurity spending ?
news.summary: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) allocated Rs 625 crore in the Union Budget 2023 to enhance cybersecurity infrastructure. Rs 400 crore was allocated to Cyber Security projects, while Rs 225 crore went to CERT-In. The allocation was influenced by cyber attacks faced by the country, including the AIIMS hospital attack by Chinese hackers.

news.headline: Interim Budget 2024: A trailer of the visionary roadmap for "Viksit Bharat" - key tax proposals to know
news.summary: The finance minister set the stage for a "Viksit Bharat by 2047", on the core principles of ‘Sabka Saath’, ‘Sabka Vikas’, ‘Sabka Vishwas’, with ‘Sabka Prayas’ being added as a new theme in the interim Budget.

news.headline: Himachal Pradesh Budget 2024: 850 education institutes to be developed as institution of excellence
news.summary: 850 educational institutions in Himachal Pradesh will be developed as Institutions of Excellence in the 2024-25 fiscal. Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu allocated Rs 9,560 crore from the budget to the education sector. Smart classrooms, full strength of teachers and performance-based grants will be provided. Anganwadi workers will be selected as nursery teachers.

news.headline: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2024 attire: A celebration of 'Ramar Blue' and Indian textiles
news.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's attire during Budget 2024, a 'Ramar' blue and cream-coloured silk sari with Kantha embroidery, reflects her commitment to indigenous craftsmanship and heritage. The sari's unique color finds mention in Valmiki's Ramayana and highlights the broader theme of promoting traditional Indian aesthetics.

news.headline: Budget 2024: Airport development on expeditiously, says Nirmala Sitharaman
news.summary: The expansion of existing airports and development of new airports will continue. One concern for airlines is the dearth of night parking bays at metro airports like Mumbai. The first commercial flight from Navi Mumbai airport is expected by March end 2025. UDAN-3 faced challenges in commencing operations on awarded routes.

news.headline: IIT's Third Overseas Campus Likely To Come Up In Sri Lanka
news.summary: IIT Campus In Sri Lanka: The proposal was made in November last year during the presentation of the 2024 Budget by Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who concurrently holds the position of finance minister.

news.headline: "Our 3rd Term Is Not Far Away, It Will Be One Of Big Decisions": PM Modi
news.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his last speech in parliament before the general elections reiterated his promise of pushing the Indian economy forward.

news.headline: "This Is The Right Time": Nirmala Sitharaman Explains White Paper Call
news.summary: The Indian economy has been transformed from a "fragile" state to one of the largest in the world, and this is the right time to commission a white paper, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told NDTV Friday in her first post-budget interview.

news.headline: Interim Budget 2024: In Interim Budget, Funds For Lakshadweep Amid India-Maldives Row
news.summary: The government will invest significantly in the tourism sector in the country, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in her interim Budget 2024 speech today.

news.headline: Budget 2024: A Look At Longest And Shortest Budget Speeches In Indian History
news.summary: The first Union Budget in Independent India was presented by then Finance Minister RK Shanmukham Chetty in November 1947. Over the years, successive Finance Ministers have left their imprints on the Budget process.

news.headline: Explained: Why Was Railway Budget Merged With Union Budget
news.summary: Every year, the allocations towards Indian Railways are keenly watched during the Union Budget presentation as a major part of government spending goes to the sector. Prior to 2017, the Railway Budget used to be presented separately.

news.headline: What Can Middle-Class Taxpayers Expect From Budget? Experts Say This
news.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget in Parliament on February 1, 2024. Since this is an election year, it is going to be an interim budget.

news.headline: 3 Trends For Coming Years, Highlighted By Government's Economic Report
news.summary: The Indian economy is likely to grow at over 7 per cent in the next few years and the country is set to become the third largest economy, the government has said in a report, "The Indian Economy - A Review" ahead of the interim Budget.

news.category: Written by Radhika Parashar, Edited by Siddharth Suvarna
news.headline: #ReduceCryptoTax: India’s Web3 Community Demands Relief, Offers Ideas Ahead of Budget 2024
news.summary: For the last two years, the Indian government has paid no heed to the sentiment of the Web3 community, that has been urging for a revision on crypto-related tax laws. Ahead of the upcoming budget announcement for the year 2024-2025, the Web3 community of India have hit social networking platforms with the hashtag -- ‘#ReduceCryptoTax’.

news.headline: Sports Ministry Gets Rs 700 Crore Plus Boost In Union Budget
news.summary: In a year when the Indian athletes will compete at the Asian Games and prepare for 2024 Paris Olympics, the Sports Ministry has got a fillip with the government allocating Rs 3,397.32 crore, an increase of Rs 723.97 crore, in the Union Budget on Wednesday

news.headline: Budget 2023: Centre To Borrow Record $198 Billion In Fiscal 2023/24- Report
news.summary: The Indian government will borrow a record 16 trillion rupees ($198 billion) in the fiscal year to March 2024, according to a Reuters poll of economists, who said

news.headline: No Spending Spree Likely In Final Budget Before 2024 Election: Report
news.summary: The Indian government will focus on fiscal consolidation in its Feb. 1 budget, the last full one before a 2024 general election.

news.headline: India Aiming At $250-Billion Maritime Economy By 2024: Defence Secretary
news.summary: The maritime economy constitutes nearly five per cent of the world economy, Defence Secretary Ajay Kumar said.

news.headline: Opinion: $5 Trillion Economy By 2024? Magic Realism At Play Given Current Low
news.summary: Yes, we need more comprehensive reforms. But when the economy is going off the rails, pushing it back on track is the main priority, as opposed to improving the quality of tracks so that it can run faster. To achieve that, putting more purchasing power in the hands of billions of consumers and lowering the regulatory and tax burdens on the millions...

news.headline: Budget 2019: Har Ghar Jal For All Rural Houses By 2024
news.summary: "Ensuring India's water security and providing access to safe drinking water to all Indians is a priority. A major step in this direction has been the constitution of Jal Shakti Ministry," Nirmala Sitharaman stated in the Parliament while presenting the Union Budget 2019-20.
